name: Maple Leaf
description: Maple leaves are palmate, lobed leaves commonly found in temperate regions. They are known for their vibrant red, orange, and yellow fall colors.
uses: Maple leaves are often used as symbols of Canada and are used in decoration during the fall. The sap of some maple species is used to make maple syrup.
habitat: Temperate regions, mainly in North America, Europe, and Asia.

name: Oak Leaf
description: Oak leaves are lobed and can vary in shape, with some species having deeply lobed leaves, while others are more rounded. They are typically thick and leathery.
uses: Oak leaves are symbolic of strength and endurance. The wood of oak trees is used in furniture, flooring, and barrels for aging wine and whiskey.
habitat: Widespread in the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, North America, and Asia.

name: Pine Needle
description: Pine needles are long, thin, and evergreen. They grow in clusters and can be found in various lengths depending on the species.
uses: Pine needles are used for making essential oils, herbal teas, and as a natural mulch. Pine wood is widely used in construction and paper manufacturing.
habitat: Widely distributed in temperate and subtropical regions of the Northern Hemisphere.

name: Birch Leaf
description: Birch leaves are simple, alternate, and ovate with serrated edges. They are typically bright green, turning yellow in autumn.
uses: Birch leaves have traditional medicinal uses, such as in herbal teas. The bark is used in traditional crafts, and birch wood is used for furniture and firewood.
habitat: Common in cooler regions of the Northern Hemisphere, such as North America, Europe, and Asia.

name: Eucalyptus Leaf
description: Eucalyptus leaves are elongated, leathery, and aromatic. They are evergreen and contain essential oils.
uses: Eucalyptus leaves are used for their medicinal properties, especially in respiratory treatments. The wood is used in construction and for making paper.
habitat: Native to Australia but also found in parts of Asia, Europe, and the Americas.

name: Bamboo Leaf
description: Bamboo leaves are narrow, elongated, and evergreen. They grow on bamboo plants, which are actually giant grasses.
uses: Bamboo leaves are used in traditional medicine, cooking (as wrappers), and crafts. Bamboo wood is widely used for construction, furniture, and paper.
habitat: Tropical and subtropical regions, especially in Asia and the Americas.

name: Palm Leaf
description: Palm leaves are large, often fan-shaped or feather-shaped. They are evergreen and grow on palm trees in tropical regions.
uses: Palm leaves are used in traditional roofing materials, weaving, and as decoration. The wood is used for construction and crafts.
habitat: Primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions around the world.
